passage_text: Triangle Centroid. The geometric centroid (center of mass) of the polygon vertices of a triangle is the point (sometimes also denoted) which is also the intersection of the triangle's three triangle medians (Johnson 1929, p. 249; Wells 1991, p. 150). The point is therefore sometimes called the median point.
